content:
A horse is tied to a five-meter rope in front of an old saloon. Ten meters behind the horse is a bale of hay. Without breaking his rope, the horse is able to eat the hay whenever he chooses.
How is this possible?
1. The walls of the saloon retract or collapse inwards, creating more space for the horse to reach the hay.
2. The rope is not tied to anything else.
3. The rope stretches proportionally, providing the extra length needed for the horse to reach the hay ten meters away.

There were eight girls going to school. They were sharing one umbrella. How come all the girls did not get wet?
1. The umbrella that the girls were sharing was exceptionally large or had a wide canopy.
2. Because it was not raining.
3. The eight girls could have been sharing the umbrella at different times or taking turns using it.

Even if they are starving, natives living in the Arctic will never eat a penguin's egg. Why not?
1. Penguins only live in Antarctica.
2. Penguins' eggs are toxic.
3. Penguins and their eggs are not part of their traditional or cultural diet.

Tom and his younger sister were fighting. Their mother was tired of the fighting and decided to punish them by making them stand on the same piece of newspaper in such a way that they couldn't touch each other. How did she accomplish this?
1. Tom's mother slid a newspaper under a door, each sibling standing on each side.
2. Tom and his younger sister stand on the newspaper back-to-back.
3. The newspaper was folded multiple times and ended with a special shape.

Mr. and Mrs. Mustard have six daughters and each daughter has one brother. But there are only 9 people in the family, how is that possible?
1. Some daughters get married and have their own family.
2. Each daughter shares the same brother.
3. Some brothers were not loved by family and moved away.

Joe and Sally were sitting in their family room one night. While Joe was watching T.V, his wife Sally was reading. All of a sudden the power went out and Joe decided to go to bed, but Sally kept on reading. With no use of artificial light, Sally kept on reading. How?
1. Sally is smart that she pretended to reading the book.
2. Sally was blind, she was reading a book by Braille.
3. Because it was daytime.

Five apples are in a basket. How do you divide them among five girls so that each girl gets an apple, but one apple remains in the basket?
1. Two girls decide to share one apple.
2. One girl is polite and return her apple back.
3. Give the fifth girl her apple in the basket.

Samuel was out for a walk when it started to rain. He did not have an umbrella and he wasn't wearing a hat. His clothes were soaked, yet not a single hair on his head got wet. How could this happen?
1. His hair is dyed.

2. This man is bald.
3. This man walk upside down to avoid rain.

There once was an evil wizard. He took 3 woman from their homes and turned them into rose bushes that looked exactly alike. He put them in his garden. One of the woman had a husband and children and begged the wizard to let her see them. He agreed. At night, he brought the woman to her house. In the morning he came and took her home. One day the husband decided to go rescue her. So he stuck into the wizard's garden. He looked and looked at the 3 identical rose bushes trying to figure out which could be his wife. Suddenly, he knew the answer and he took his wife home. How did he know which rose bush was his wife?
1. The husband knew which rose bush was his wife because it was the only one that still had her distinctive scent.
2. The wizard brought the rosebush to her home at night and returned her to the garden in the morning. Therefore, she was the only plant without dew.
3. The husband knew which rose bush was his wife because it was the only one that leaned towards him as he approached

One day a little boy named John went over to his parents and said that he wanted to shoot people and blow them up. His parents were really proud of his career choice. keep in mind that his parents were not very violent people. Why?
1. John wanted to be a photographer.
2. The parents known John was kiding and didn't pay attention.
3. John wants to be a video game designer  and his parent are addicted to vedio gams.

Two men were playing tennis. They played five sets and each man won three sets. How can this be possible?
1. The two men were partners playing doubles.
2. They followed a round-robin format, where each player competes against every other player in the tournament.
3. They were playing tennis in turns.

A simple peasant bought a number of camels and is taking them to his farm. As he rides contentedly along he counts them - he counts 29. He was sure he had bought 30 camel, so in alarm he jumps off his camel and counts the camels again. To his delight there are 30. Half an hour later, he counts his camels and once more there are just 29. Confused, he climbs off his camel and counts again. Once more there are 30. Can you explain?
1. One camel had moved away from the group when the peasant was counting.
2. The peasant is mistakenly considering himself as one of the camels when he counts them.
3. When he is on the camel he omits to count it.

On a fine sunny day a ship was in the harbor. All of a sudden the ship began to sink. There was no storm and nothing wrong with the ship yet it sank right in front of the spectators eyes. What caused the ship to sink?
1. It was a Submarine.
2. There are too many spectators in the harbor.
3. There are too many fish around the ship.

A woman shoots her husband. Then she holds him underwater for over 5 minutes. Finally, she hangs him. But 5 minutes later, they both go out and enjoy a wonderful dinner together. How can this be?
1. The woman gets arrested for murder after dinner.
2. The woman gets a new partner.
3. The woman was a photographer. She shot a picture of her husband, developed it, and hung it up to dry.

A man who lived on the top floor of a twenty story building had to go up and down daily for work, and of course, for food and the other necessities. On most days he could only ride the elevator to the fifteenth story, and he would have to walk the rest of the way. When it rained, however, he could ride all the way up to the twentieth story. Why?
1. The building had a system in place where, during rainy conditions, certain residents were granted exclusive access to the higher floors. 
2. During rainy weather, the elevator was programmed to automatically bypass certain floors above the fifteenth story. 
3. The man wasn't tall enough to reach the button for the 20th floor. He could only reach the 15th story button on the elevator. When it rained, he brought his umbrella, and used it to press the 20th story button on the elevator.

A man moved into a new house and decided he was tired after the journey and turned off all the lights and went to bed. The next morning he killed 365 people, he does not sleep walk he slept like a baby. How could this be?
1. The man is a world-renowned botanist who has just moved into a new house with a rare greenhouse containing 365 unique and endangered plant species.
2. The man could be a calendar maker. He accidentally excluding February 29th on a leap year's calendar before sleep. This "killed" the day for 365 people.
3. He lived in a light house.

All of Mrs. Smith pets are dogs except one, and all her pets are cats except one. But Mrs.Smith only has 2 pets, how is that possible?
1. Mrs.Smith has one additional pet that is neither a dog or a cat.
2. Mrs.Smith has one hybrid pet that is a dog and a cat at the same time.
3. Mrs. Smith has one cat and one dog.

A black dog stands in the middle of an intersection in a town painted black. None of the street lights are working due to a power failure caused by a storm. A car with two broken headlights drives towards the dog but turns in time to avoid hitting him. How could the driver have seen the dog in time?
1. It was during the daylight hours.
2. The broken headlights can emit a small amount of light, even if it's dim. 
3. The driver could have relied on their sense of hearing to detect the presence of the dog.

There are 3 apples for 2 sons and 2 fathers to eat. Each of them get their own apple. How is it numerically possible?
1. Two sons shared the same apple.
2. They are one son, one father and one grandfather.
3. One father gave his apple to his son.

The 22nd and 24th presidents of the United States of America had the same parents, but were not brothers. How can this be possible?
1. They were the same man.
2. Their parents got divorced.
3. The 24th president has better performance during tenure.

A horse jumps over a tower and the tower disappears. It's not an illusion or a dream. So where could this happen?
1. On the moon.
2. On a chessboard.
3. Under the sea.

Brad started through the dirty sort-shared window on the 22nd floor of the office tower. Overcome with depression he slid the window open and jumped through it. It was a sheer drop outside the building to the ground. Miraculously after he landed he was completely uninjured. Since there was nothing to cushion his fall or slow his descent, how could he have survived the fall?
1. The ground outside the building is wet.
2. Brad was so sick and tired of window washing, he opened the window and jumped inside.
3. Consistent exercise has made him a very strong man.

A certain large animal lives happily and thrives here on Earth. One day, every single one of these writers is wiped out by a mysterious disease that affects only this particular animal. There are none left anywhere on earth -- they are all gone. About a year or so later, they begin to reappear on Earth again. How can this be?
1. The animal is the dinosaur. Millions of years ago, dinosaurs roamed the Earth, but eventually, they became extinct due to various factors such as climate change or asteroid impact.
2. The animal is the butterfly. During the pupal stage of their life cycle, butterflies are inside a protective casing, and it may appear as if they have completely disappeared or been wiped out.
3. The animal is the Mule. Since all Mules are born sterile, you can only get a Mule by crossing a donkey with a horse.

A horse travels a certain distance each day. Strangely enough, two of its legs travel 30 miles each day and the other two legs travel nearly 31 miles. It would seem that two of the horse's legs must be one mile ahead of the other two legs, but of course, this can't be true, since the horse is normal. How is this possible?
1. The horse operates a mill and travels in a circular clockwise direction. The two outside legs will travel a greater distance than the two inside legs.
2. Because the Earth is not a perfect sphere.
3. The measurements are taken from different reference points.

Four men were in a boat on the lake. The boat turns over, and all four men sink to the bottom of the lake, yet not a single man got wet! Why?
1. Despite the boat turning over and sinking, the water level was not high enough to reach the men's bodies.
2. Because they were all married and not single.
3. The lake was frozen, none of the men got wet despite sinking to the bottom.

There are three doors. In each door is a way to die. The first door has fire and lava. The second door has lions that haven't eaten in 5 years. In the third door, there is a 1,000-foot drop into an alligator. Which door will you likely survive?
1. The first door, the first door is destroyed and you can see the fire in it.
2. The third door, the alligator can be tierd and won't eat people.
3. The second door with the lions. Since they haven't eaten in 5 years they will have died.

There were 5 men traveling down a road and it started to rain and 4 men sped up, the 5th did not, but they all arrived at the same place at the same time but all of them were wet besides the 5th. How is that possible?
1. The 5th man beated them at the end.
2. He was dead and in a coffin.
3. The 5th man walked slowly to dodge the raining.

Three men sitting in a small motorboat one meter from the shoreline. The first is afraid of water, the second is afraid of drowning, and the third is afraid of sharks. The boat's motor is not operational and there is nothing to row with. How do they get to the shoreline?
1. They can wait until water level is high enough, they can safely step out onto the shoreline. 
2. They can just walk onto its as the boat is one-meter inland.
3. 
They can wait until the water evaporates completely.

A father and son were in a car accident where the father was killed. The ambulance brought the son to the hospital. He needed immediate surgery. In the operating room, a doctor came in and looked at the little boy and said I can't operate on him he is my son. Why?
1. The son has two fathers.
2. The son calls the police for help to save his father.
3. Because the doctor is the mother of the son.

One lady ordered a fast delivery pizza and her order came the next year. How is this possible?
1. The courier got lost and spent the whole year to find the way.
2. She ordered the pizza for New Year's Day.
3. The pizza store was out of ingredients.

Dorothy has never expressed suicidal thoughts, but whenever she experiences feelings of sadness or depression, she makes arrangements to travel to a very high spot that she has visited on numerous occasions. Once there, she proceeds to jump from that great height. The fascinating fact though is she has never been injured from this leap, and in fact, she tells everyone that she feels much better afterward. If she’s not suicidal, then what is going on here, and why has she never been injured, or even worse, died from her risky actions?
1. Consistent exercise has made him a very strong man.
2. Dprpyju was just raving to show her is outstanding.
3. Dorothy is a sky jumper.

A man walking along a railroad track sees a train laundering at high speed towards him. Instead of immediately jumping off the track, he charges directly at the train for about ten feet and only then gets off the track. Why?
1. By moving towards the train momentarily, the man minimizes the risk of being hit directly by the front of the train.
2. The man was on a bridge when he first saw the train so he couldn't jump off the track immediately.
3. By moving towards the oncoming train, the man's brain interprets the change in distance and relative motion as a decrease in speed.

I dig out tiny caves and store gold and silver in them. I also build bridges of silver and make crowns of gold. They are the smallest you could imagine. Sooner or later everybody needs my help, yet many people are afraid to let me help them. Why?
1. I am a theif.
2. I am a dentist.
3. I am a miner.

A beggar's brother died, but the man who died had no brother. How could that be?
1. The man is angry for his brother being a beggar and cut ties with him.
2. The bagger's brother is a murderer.
3. The beggar was the man's sister.

A plane crashed, and every single person on board this flight was killed, yet there were survivors. Explain how?
1. The survivors could refer to individuals who were not on the plane.
2. The married people lived and the singles died.
3. Some people died later.

How could a cowboy ride into town on Friday, stay two days, and ride out on Wednesday?
1. While in town, he stays in bed for two days.
2. His horse is named Wednesday.
3. Friday and Saturday are holidays.

Danny was driving his semi under an overpass when suddenly he came to a screening halt. Danny wasn't paying enough attention and inadvertently drove under the overpass that was just barely as high as his truck. The semi was wedge so tightly that he could not go forward or backward. A fellow tracker came by and told him how he could easily get the semi out from under the bridge. What did he suggest?
1. He told Danny to left the bridge.
2. He told Danny to overturn the track.
3. He told Danny to let some air out of his tires.

A boy had just gotten out of the shower and was getting ready for his prom, shaved and with cologne, and there would be an after-party. And his mom and dad said to be home for the next sunrise and he was home for the next sunrise but with a full-grown beard. How can this be?
1. His beard grows in an amazing speed.
2. He went crazy with friends in that unnormal party.
3. He lives in Alaska and sunrise are every six months.

Why is it so cold on Christmas?
1. Because it's in December.
2. Because people are waiting for the New Year.
3. Because people are celebrating.

Wednesday,Tom and Joe went to a restaurant and ate dinner. When they were done they paid and left. Tom and Joe didn't pay. Who did?
1. Wednesday. The name of the third person in the group, not the day.
2. The restaurant is too expensive.
3. They found money in their hamburger.

In Jamaica, if you drop a steel ball weighing five pounds from a height of 45 inches, it falls more rapidly through the water at 40 degrees Fahrenheit than water at 20 degrees Fahrenheit. How is that possible?
1. The temperature of stell ball is more consistent with water in 40 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. At 20 degrees Fahrenheit the water would be ice.
3. The temperature of stell ball is more consistent with water in 20 degrees Fahrenheit.

A woman who lives in new york legally married three men, she did not get divorce, get an enrollment, or legally seperate. How is this possible?
1. His husband is not a good husband.
2. The woman is not a good person.
3. She is a minister.

A magician had a water glass that was filled to the top. Holding the glass above his head he let it drop to the carpet without spilling a single drop of water. How could he manage to drop the glass from a height of six feet and not spill any water?
1. The glass was filled, but not with water.
2. The glass is too heavy.
3. Surface tension prevents water from spilling.

Two camels were facing in opposite directions. One was facing due East and one was facing due West. They were in the desert so there was no reflection. How can they manage to see each other without walking around or turning around or moving their heads?
1. They were in the middle of desert.
2. Their eyes have a very wide view.
3. The two camels were facing each other the entire time.

Morgan was making apricot jam. She put all the apricots in the pot and stirred them up. Then she remembered she had to add 1 ounce of lemon juice for every two apricots! How did she figure out how much lemon juice to put?
1. She is an execellent chef.
2. She is good at physicis.
3. She counted the pits of apricots.

George was cleaning the windows on the eighteenth floor of an office block when there was a massive power failure. The electric hoist on his platform was immoblized. So how did he manage to get down before the power was restored?
1. George get to the roof and escape.
2. George needs to lift a heavy object.
3. George walked down the stairs. He was cleaning the inside of the windows.

A truck driver went three blocks the wrong way down a one-way street without breaking the law. How come?
1. There is no people on that street.
2. He tried to get away from the police.
3. The truck driver was walking.

A sharpshooter hung up his hat and put on a blindfolded. He then walked 100 yards, turned around, and shot a bullet through his hat. The blindfolded was a perfectly good one, completely blocking the man's vision. How did he manage this?
1. He uses a computer to compute his actions.
2. He hung his hat on the barrel of his gun.
3. He uses the sound to feel the direction.

A woman went to visit her bank manager and she took her young daughter with her. The bank manager said that the woman's daughter could stay with his secretary during the meeting. When the woman and her daughter left, the secretary turned to the other secretary and said to her, "That little girl was my daughter." How could that be?
1. The girl has two mothers.
2. The gril's mother gets a promotion.
3. The secretary was the girl's father.

Nolan is outside a shop. She can not read the signs but she knows she needs to go in to make a purchase. What store is she at?
1. Eye glasses store.
2. Fruit store.
3. Bakery.

There was a man who everybody called Batman he knew nothing about bats and thought they were gross. He still loved it when people called him Batman! How could this be?
1. He is afraid others will laugh at him.
2. He was the star baseball player.
3. He tries to be friendly.

Craig died in Florida. Shortly after, Tracy died at sea. Nobody mourned, In fact, everyone was absolute delighted. Why?
1. They were both hurricanes.
2. People are getting used to it.
3. It is a culture traditional.

I left my campsite and hired south for 3 miles. Then I turned east and hired for 3 miles. I then turned north and hired for 3 miles, at which time I came upon a bear inside my tent eating my food! What color was the bear?

1. Black.
2. White.

3. Brown.

How can a man who shaves several times a day still sport a long beard?

1. He's a barber.
2. He wants his girlfriend to buy him a razor.
3. The man's beard grows in a crazy speed.

Maria and Juliana went out for drinks together. They ordered the same drink. Juliana was really thirsty and finished five in the time it took Maria to finish one. The drinks were poisoned, but only Maria died. How?
1. The poison is unfunctional when you drink them together.
2. The poison need time to dissolve.
3. The poison was in the ice.

A man stands on one side of a river, his dog on the other. The man calls his dog, who immediately crosses the river without getting wet and without using a bridge or a boat. How did the dog do it?
1. The river was frozen.
2. The dog can dry off in a sudden.
3. The dog jumped half-mile far and get to the man.

Two cops walked into a room with no windows and found a dead man who obviously hung himself from the ceiling, though they couldn't figure out how. There was no chair beneath him that he might have jumped off of, or a table. Just a paddle of water. How'd he do it?
1. The man sat on the floor.
2. He stood on a block of ice until it melted.
3. He positioned himself.

A man dies of old age on his 25 birthday. How is this possible?

1. He was born on February 29th

2. His life is not worth living.
3. The man is not healthy.

A rancher had 500 cows and took one shot that got them all. How did he do it?
1. A shotgun.
2. A big pistol.
3. A panoramic photo.

How did the boy kick his soccer ball ten feet, and then have it come back to him on its own?

1. The wind is so strong that the ball doesn't fly so far.
2. There is a rope between the ball and the boy.
3. He kicked it up.

A man buys a rope from a woman for $3.00 and hands the woman a $10 bill. The woman goes into the grocery store next door to get change. She returns and gives the man $7.00. After the man leaves, the clerk from the store comes and says, "Hey, that was a counterfeit bill you gave me." The woman gives the clerk a good bill. How much has the woman lost?
1. Seven dollars.
2. Seven dollars plus the rope.
3. Thirteen dollars.

Sally lives in a place where six months of the year is mild summer and the temperature drops significantly the other six months. She owns a lake where there is a small island. She wants to build a house on the island and needs to get materials there. She doesn't have a boat, plane, or anything to transport them to the island. How does Sally solve this problem?

1. She waits to take the materials over during the colder months because the lake will freeze over, so she can walk over it.
2. She borrows necessary materials from her neighborhood. Her neighborhood is rich and friendly.
3. She drives a plane to load all the material she needs to the island.

Mrs. Adams tells her neighbor that her son turns 16 today and that next birthday he'll be 20. How can that be?
1. He was born on February 29.

2. His life is not worth living.
3. The man is not healthy.

A man dressed in all black is walking down a country lane. Suddenly, a large black car with no lights on comes around the corner and speeches to a halt. How did the car's driver know he was there?
1. It was day time.

2. The driver is good at listening.
3. The driver was paying much attention.

Why are 1968 pennies worth more than 1967 pennies?
1. Old money weight more than new money.
2. Old money is dirtier than new money.
3. Because there is one more penny in 1968 pennies than in 1967 pennies

A woman is sitting in her hotel room and hears a knock at the door. She opens the door to see a man whom she's never met before. He says, "I'm sorry, I have made a mistake, I thought this was my room." He then goes down the corridor and into the elevator. The woman goes back into her room and calls security. What made the woman so suspicious of the man?

1. The woman knows this man on the newspaper.
2. The woman thought the man is rude.
3. If he really thought it was his hotel room, he would have tried to open the door not knock on it first.

While a cat was outside, it started to downpour. The cat couldn’t find any shelter and got completely soaked by the rain, yet not a single hair was wet. How could this be?
1. The cat succeeded in avoiding all rain drops.
2. It was a hairless cat.
3. The outside whether is changing frequently.

Two mothers and two daughters went out to eat, everyone ate one slice of pizza, yet only three slices were eaten. How's that possible?

1. One piece of pizza is enough for two girls.
2. One mother gave her pizza to two girls.
3. The group included a grandmother, her daughter and her daughter's daughter.

Some months have eight letters in their name, whereas others have five. How many have three?

1. They all do.
2. June.
3. March.

If the vice president were to die, who is supposed to be president?
1. The President.
2. The speaker of the House.
3. The Cabinet members.

Name the most recent year in which New Year's came before Christmas.

1. This year. 

2. Last year.
3. 2000.0

David's birthday is in December, but it is never in the winter. Why? 
1. His family will hold a huge celebration for him.
2. He alwasy gets cold in winter.
3. He lives in Australia.

Sandy claims she saw an ocean without water, and it turns out, she was being honest. How is that possible?

1. Ocean is too cold that it freezes totally.
2. The whether is too hot that vaporates all water.
3. The ocean is on a map.

There lived a man in a house and every time he went to bed he turned on the light. One night, the man forgot to turn on the light. The next day he read the paper and sinking into deep self-blame. Why? 
1. The man is a world-renowned botanist moved into a rare greenhouse.
2. The man is a calendar maker.
3. The man lived in a lighthouse. He forgot to turn on the light and a ship crashed.

Two men had to go to the south side of the river, the river is pretty wide and rapid. There is one boat, but only one person fits on it. Lucky they both got to the south side of the river. How? 
1. One men go home to get a another boat.
2. They both jump to the south side.
3. One person already at the south side of the river.

Two teams were playing soccer against each other. One player from Team One scored a hat trick (triple goal). Their teammates were very happy. But when he scored the fourth goal, their teammates scolded him instead. How could this be possible?
1. His teammates is envy about him.
2. The player scored in their own goal.
3. He should focus more on defense.

A girl slipped and fell into a 60-foot well, yet she didn't get wet. How is this possible?
1. The well is dry.
2. The well is too deep.
3. The water is too hot.

Three people are stuck inside a dark cave. The first fears the complete darkness, the second fears bats, and the third fears getting lost. They don't have any flashlights, lanterns or any kind of light source, and their cell phones have no signal so they can't use them as a light source either. How do they get out of the cave?
1. They can just walk out as it's daytime outside the cave.
2. They run over around the whole cave and find the way out.
3. They try to run away from the bat.

A man is walking along the sea beach. To his surprise, he can clearly see his own footstep without turning back. How is that possible?
1. He is walking backward.
2. The footstep will move all over around with water.
3. The reflection by the sea let him saw the footsetp.

A woman living in London, has four sons. All of them are doctors, but none of them ever attended medical school. How is this possible?
1. Woman's sons learned all their knowledge by themselves.
2. The woman's sons are all "doctors" in the academic sense 
3. Woman's sons are too busy to take courses in medical school.

There is a pink single-story house and everything in it is pink. The doors are pink, the windows are pink and the top is pink. What color are the stairs?
1. There are no stairs in a single story house.
2. It should be pink as the whole house is in pink.
3. The stairs is uncolored as people always step on that.

There are 8 brothers. Brother 1 is playing checkers. Brother 2 is eating. Brother 3 is watching video games. Brother 4 is dancing. Brother 5 is texting. Brother 6 is at school. Brother 7 is sleeping. What is Brother 8 doing?
1. Brother 8 is sleeping.
2. Brother 8 is dancing.
3. Brother 8 is playing checkers.

A girl went over to the U.S. on the 4th of July and parties for 3 days and came back on the 4th of July. How did she do that?
1. The girl drank a lot and slept at party for 3 days.
2. July 7th is holiday.
3. She went over on the date of the 4th of July and came home on the boat called the July 4.

A bus driver was heading down a street in Colorado. He went right past a stop sign without stopping, he turned left where there was a "no left turn" sign, and he went the wrong way on a one-way street. Then he went on the left side of the road past a cop car. Still - he didn't break any traffic laws. Why not?
1. He was walking.
2. There was no police in that cop car.
3. He tried to get away from the police.

There was a farmer who had a problem with his chicken coop, and he wanted to go check it out. When he got there he noticed that there was a rooster on top of the barn. Now the barn was shaped with a triangle-type top. But suddenly the rooster laid an egg. Which side did it roll on?
1.  There is a hole in the roof. Furthermore, the egg dropped into the hole.
2. It didn't because rosters don't lay eggs.
3. It is possible the egg would roll down the middle of the triangle-shaped top of the barn.

Two girls have the same parents and were born at the same hour of the same day of the same month, but they are not twins. How can this be possible?
1. One girl ran away from home at a young age.
2. They were not born in the same year.
3. One gril has father's last name, one girl has mother's last name.

I buried a stone in the ground, and it grew and produced fruit. How is this possible?
1. The ground is close to a lake.
2. The whether condition is pleasant.
3. The stone was actually a seed, not an ordinary stone. The seed of a cherry is called a stone.

Two fathers and two sons went fishing one day. They were there the whole day and only caught 3 fish. One father said, that is enough for all of us, we will have one each. How can this be possible?
1. Two sons shared the same fish.
2. There was the father, his son, and his son's son.
3. One father gave his fish to his son.

A pet shop owner had a parrot with a sign on its cage that said "Parrot repeats everything it hears". Davey bought the parrot and for two weeks he spoke to it and it didn't say a word. He returned the parrot but the shopkeeper said he never lied about the parrot. How can this be?
1. The parrot was tired.
2. Davey was deaf.
3. The parrot was deaf.

How can you physically stand behind your friend as he physically stands behind you?
1. By standing stand upside down.
2. With the help of optical illusions.
3. By standing back to back.

A man was just doing his job when his suit was torn. Why did he die three minutes later?
1. His suit was so expensive that he couldn't  afford to buy a new one.
2. He was an astronaut on a space walk, doing repairs.
3. He never ruin clothes before. His heart couldn't handle the stress, leading to his unfortunate demise.

Two students attend the same school, have the same teacher, and were born on the same day of the same month, but they are not siblings. How can this be possible?
1. One student ran away from home at a young age.
2. They were not born in the same year.
3. One student had a bad academic grades and broken up with his parents.

How can you leave a room with two legs and return with six legs?
1. Bring another man back with you.
2. You're walking back upside down.
3. Bring a chair back with you.

All the electricity was out in town and none of the street lights or traffic signals had power. A dark limousine was cruising down the newly paved blacktop, with its headlights off. A young boy dressed totally in black (with no reflector) stepped out to cross the street. The moon wasn't out and the boy had no flashlight, yet the driver stopped to let the boy cross the street. How did the driver see the boy?
1. The driver saw the boy because it was during the daylight hours.
2. The driver was good at listening.
3. The driver was paying much attention on the road.

A man is late for an appointment and, in his haste, takes a corner so fast that only two wheels were on the pavement. A policeman is standing on the corner, but he did not give him a ticket. Why?
1. He was on a motorcycle.
2. The policeman was superised by his driving skill.
3. The two car wheels was large enough to support the him.

A man was born in 1898. He is still alive now at the age 33  How is this possible ?
1. he was born in room 1898 in the hospital.
2. He never celebrate his birthday after 33 years old.
3. His birthday is February 29th, which is celebrated every four years.

Some months have 30 days, some months have 31 days. How many have 28?
1. One, February.
2. They all do.
3. Two, the first and end month of the year.

Imagine Johnny, a party clown, is carrying three pieces of gold each piece weighing one kilogram. While taking a walk he comes to a bridge that has a sign posted saying the bridge could hold only a maximum of 80 kilograms. John weighs 78 kilograms and the gold weighs three kilograms. Johnny reads the sign and still safely crossed the bridge with all the gold. How did he manage this?
1. Johnny burried one gold in the start of the bridge and make sure the location is private enough that no one can find.
2. Johnny sank the gold to the bottom of the river and left a mark so that he could find it later.
3. Johnny is a clown so he has mastered juggling. When he came to the bridge he judged the gold, always keeping one piece in the air.

Four cars come to a four way stop, all coming from a different direction. They can't decide who got there first, so they all go forward at the same time. They do not crash into each other, but all four cars go. How is this possible?
1. Their cars have different heights that can drive beyond each other.
2. They all made right-hand turns.
3. They decided to drive reversely with their rears forward first.

Four men sat down to play, They played all night till the break of day. They played for gold and not for fun, With separate scores for every one. When they had come to square accounts, They all had made quite fair amounts. Can you explain the paradox, If no one lost, how all could gain?
1. The men were miners..
2. The men were musicians..
3. The men were pokers..
